page.title: 08Agriculture Wheldons.
page.content: Peter Wheldons orchard started up about 50 years ago in 1930.It has grown up over the years and now has 360 acres of land.It is run by Peter Wheldon and his two sons.Up to 100 people are permanently employed there.People age 10-15 are employed part time to pick left over blackcurrants.They get paid according to how much they collect.There are a large variety of fruit trees which grow 47 kinds of apples.They also have bush-fruits such as rasberries,goosberries and currants.People can pick their own fruit if they prefer or buy it ready packed.The ground is irrigated by a series of underground pipes which get water from bore-holes approximately 260 feet deep.There is also a manmade reservoir for when water demand is high.
